Name: Klettermäuse
Description:
The little mice want to grab the juicy apples that the wind has shaken from the tree. But here comes the sly fox, who also likes to eat apples. The little mice quickly climb the apple tree to hide. In order to get to the ripe apples in the meadow, the mice climb up and down: The little climbing mice hang onto each other and rappel down the tree. But who is the fastest and grabs the most apples from the meadow?

Two dice depicting different colors are rolled in turns. The main task for the players is to pay attention and react fast by finding the matching color combination of double-colored mice tokens by putting their hands on them.

Whoever gets the right mice first may take them - and either hang them on his branch of the large apple tree in the center of the table or - if they don't match in color - keep them for a later turn.

When a wind icon is rolled, the mice on the branches may be re-sorted and can be put together with the same colored sides, hanging from a branch in a domino-like fashion. If the chain of mice reaches 5 tokens, they get to the ground and players may pick up an apple token. The player, who gets to 2 apples first, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Uprising: Curse of the Last Emperor – Arch-Nemesis Expansion
Description:
Not only does this expansion feature 4 new races (Tua Than, Hokqan, Ytuma and the Renegade Legion), but it has 4 super-huge endbosses! There are 2 Arch-Nemesis for The Empire (The Drakoliche and The Empress), and 2 for Chaos (The Kraken and The Harvester). They replace the usual Hordes and Legions on your last Chapter - but how do they get there? Read the Omens to find out what your future holds...

—description from the publisher

Name: Coats & Hats
Description:
These coats and hats are terribly disorganized. Group them by colour to win!

Coats & Hats is a tiny card game packed with coats and hats that need sorting. Match the colour of the items on a rack, while preventing your opponent from doing the same.

Each turn, add a card to the outer edge of the rack; then either use a special ability on a card, or flip your card — there's a hat on the back of each coat. Group three items of the same colour and you score!

—description from the publisher

Name: Card Shark Pool
Description:
It's like pool, but with cards.

Card Shark Pool is a light-weight, casual card and dice game for two players. Plan your shots, clear the table.

There are no complex calculations for angle or rebounds. Roll dice based on the length of the shot, and use special abilities on each card to draw, roll, and carom.

—description from the publisher

Name: Toymakers
Description:
With just 18 cards and no other components, Toymakers is a full worker placement game; collect resources, construct buildings, make toys, spread joy!

Toymakers uses a resource management mechanism where the card you place your worker on is taken into your hand for resources. The cards double as buildings which provide more resources in a single action, and also can be upgraded to a toy, scoring you points! Time your upgrades correctly; when the last card is drawn from the middle of the table, the game ends!

—description from the publisher
Families: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

Name: Подводные города: Ибица промокарта
Description:
Grants 3 Credits and 1 VP during the Production phase.

Note: Included in the Spanish edition of Underwater cities. The Russian version of this card is available separately from the base game.

Name: Everdell: Newleaf
Description:
Everdell’s bustling city Newleaf has just opened its first train station, and many new critters and big ideas are rolling in. Newleaf introduces brand new critters, constructions, and exciting events to draw Visitor cards to your blossoming city! It also features the Train Station Board, resource-delivering Train Cars, travel-worthy Tickets, and Reservation Tokens!

—description from the publisher

Name: FRITZO Cube
Description:
The FRITZO Cube is an innovative and sophisticated game for almost all age groups. Each cube consists of 27 cubes. Each individual cube is unique in its color arrangement. The ingenious thing about it: Depending on the game variant, the dice have to be placed next to each other so that they have to meet different or matching colors in all directions.

Players earn points based on rows and "staircases" and player with the highest score wins.

—description from publisher

Name: Lines of Fixation
Description:
Lines of Fixation is an abstract strategy game for 2players, inspired by Lines of Action (LoA). As same as LoA, it also has several game pieces start from a distance, the object to unite own pieces and some move constraints, but unlike LoA, it uses a hexagonal board and stacking mechanics.

GAMEPLAY (overview)
Setup each 9 of 2-height stacks as the diagram above. Light color player goes first, alternate turns taking one move with a stack their control (That is, a stack with your color at the top).

Stacks move a straight line the distance exactly its height, dropping bottom disks exactly one by one for each hex. Dropped disks may capture opponent's stacks and/or merge with own stacks. If your mono-color stack of 3- or more height can make capture, you must do so.

And there are important restrictions; if you do not have the highest stack on a straight line, your stacks on the line cannot make any move along the line. And if both of you and your opponent have the highest stacks of same height on a line, your stacks on the line can move and merge but cannot capture.

The object is to make all stacks you control adjacent each other as a group. You can also win by having two bi-color stacks of 6-height.

-description from designer

Name: Pic Flip
Description:
Pic Flip is a card game from 7 years and up, which provides rapid fun when turning the cards over quickly.
The game principle is so easy to understand that even the youngest can play independently.
Children especially like the rapid hunt for matching cards. Whoever is the first player or first player to turn all cards over and down the fastest wins.
Develops concentration, identification and dexterity and is lots of fun.

Name: Fauna Europea
Description: Educational game in order to sensitize people about caring for the environment and the different animal and plant species focused on European fauna.

Name: Everdell: Mistwood
Description:
Lurking in the depths of Mistwood, the cunning and villainous Nightweave plots to take over Everdell with the aid of her spiderlings. Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in solo or two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from the More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

—description from the publisher

Name: Everdell: The Complete Collection
Description:
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave and meet heroes of renown like Corrin Evertail himself. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability. Will the sun shine brightest on your city?

Everdell Complete Collection contains 23 different types of Critter meeples, player powers for asymmetric play, Giant Critters with saddles to ride on, and an amazing array of pieces including wooden twigs, squishy berries, smooth pebbles, amber resin, glass pearls, and more. Featuring deluxe components, including the shiny metal point tokens and the wooden Ever Tree, this Complete Collection is the ultimate edition of Everdell.

Includes all content from:

- Everdell
- Pearlbrook
- Spirecrest
- Bellfaire
- Newleaf
- Mistwood
- Wooden Ever Tree
- Collector's upgrade packs (Freshwater, Glimmergold, and Trailblazers)
- Everdell Big Ol' Box of Storage

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Nasty Neighbors
Description:
In this game, all players are neighbors in an apartment building. However, living in a crowded block can test your nerves, especially when you have Nasty Neighbors.

After each attack you're unable to prevent, you'll pop a pill to calm your nerves. However, take too many and you're eliminated from the game.

Your goal is to force the other neighbors to leave and be declared "Lord of the Building!"

If a neighbor runs out of pills, their nervous system can't take the stress - they are forced to leave the building.

In the end, there is only one survivor... or NONE!

A dynamic game of strategy, observation, humor, and luck... everything you need to stay sane with bad neighbors.

—description from the designer

Name: Capture the Flag: Battle
Description:
Capture the Flag: Battle is a 2-4 pvp round-based-strategy game. Where you have to fight against your friends and family to see who gets the flag first!

Every round you place 1 flag in the middle of the board. If a player gets the flag and goes through the portal, he won the round. The first player that collects 2 flags, wins the game!

Every player has one life-point, if he get's attacked,he dies and goes back to the Starting-point.If a player has the flag while he gets attacked, he drops the flag on the last tile he was standing.

You can attack other players by using Attack-Cards or collect Item-Cards that will help you in the battle.

At the beginning of a round, the player must decide whether to use a card or not. After rolling the dice, the player is not allowed to use any cards. So use them carefully and wisely. Every player keeps his collected cards for the next round! If you know you can't catch up to the player with the flag, it would be wisely to keep your strong cards for the next round.

Name: Suburbia Expansions (Second Edition)
Description:
Suburbia: Expansions contains three large expansions for Suburbia that were originally released independently — Suburbia Inc., Suburbia 5â˜…, and Suburbia Nightlife — as well as two smaller expansions: Essen and Cons. These expansions can be used with Suburbia one at a time, in any mixture, or all at once!

This collection includes dozens of new building tiles, goals, and new mechanisms, such as the turn-order-altering star track, borough-enhancing borders, bonuses, challenges, a fifth player option, and more! The new buildings offer new categories as well, such as the high-risk, high-reward Nightlife tiles that provide a huge benefit while also taking a toll on your growing city.

This box is organized with GameTrayz organizers and made to be combined with the second edition of Suburbia, which has larger tiles than in the original release.

Name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Gears & Guns
Description:
Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Gears & Guns is a steampunk-themed expansion that features brand new Engineer-class Survivors, advanced weaponry, wondrous inventions, and a whole campaign with story-driven objectives and surprises to be unveiled.

We live in another world. The world of tomorrow. It took a few decades to set aside our differences. In the end, we stood together as a united nation, and took a step into the future. This is the Age of Steam!

Everyday life has been changed, and we offer an American dream to anyone willing to brave new frontiers. Railroads run by the biggest trains connect most cities, making travel fast and secure. Prosperity helps engineers create the most daring inventions. And going West will offer even more opportunities. Wild territories, vast resources: a better life! Steam carries us to these promising lands, protects us against all perils, and heralds a new dawn for civilization.

And yet...

Yet, rumors talk about frontier towns being erased from the map, of people going mad and hurling themselves into murderous rages. Is it some kind of exotic illness? Who knows, and honestly, who cares? You cannot stop progress. Full steam, in the name of science!

Gears & Guns is a campaign expansion. This means its ten missions form a single ongoing story that the Survivors experience, accumulating experience, skills, and equipment as they go. Their actions and choices each Mission may have dire ramifications down the line.

Name: H.D.P. 2020: Hasta Donde Puedas
Description: Expansion that adds more cards with the focus on Covid-19 pandemic.

Name: H.D.P. 6: Hasta Donde Puedas
Description: Sixth expansion that adds more cards.

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal #12
Description:
The exalted (and fabulously wealthy) Lord Baltazär Krüssenfalt Schweiger III guest edits this doubly exciting issue of Spike! Journal. It covers both Imperial Nobility and Black Orc teams to celebrate their stunning showing in the XL Blood Bowl final.

This 36-page magazine pulls double duty, covering the history, rules, and rosters of both the Imperial Nobility and Black Orc teams. Packed with all the fantastic fun and essential commentary you've come to expect from Spike! Journal, this magazine is the perfect companion for the savvy coach.

It includes:

- Highborn Heraldry: Exploring the background and history of Imperial Nobility teams, the various player positions, Star Players, and a team roster.

- Famous Imperial Nobility Teams: The Bögenhafen Barons are the most well-known, but you'll also find background on teams like the Ostermark Dukes, the Averland Earls, and more.

- Star Player Spotlight – Griff Oberwald: Perhaps the greatest Human Blitzer to grace the pitch and certainly one of the most recognisable, and least humble.

- The Empire’s Finest: Pro tips on coaching Imperial Nobility teams, developing your players, and getting the most from your team.

- Dirt From the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle chases down some rather unsavoury rumours about one Lord Driego Koloroff.

- Smarter Than Your Average Orc: Dig into the origins of Black Orc teams, plus information about the three positions, Star Players, and a team roster.

- Famous Black Orc Teams: You've heard of the Thunder Valley Greenskins, but don't forget about the rest, including the likes of the Orcland Raiders and Grimfang Gougers.

- Star Player Spotlight – Varag Ghoul-Chewer: Thrill to the sordid tale of the Mean Green Machine’s rise to superstardom.

- Bash ‘Em and Smash ‘Em: Tips on taking your Black Orcs to the top. Lead your fresh green rookies to seasoned green old-timers, with helpful diagrams and example rosters.

- Chat with the Rat: Hackspit Quillchewer chats-talks with Gurgnie Shwarzenorc, who wants to share an exciting opportunity to help you achieve the muscle mass you long for.

- Coffin Corner: The ever-amusing column covering the most gruesome and entertaining Blood Bowl deaths, on and off the pitch.

- The Brut-iful Game: A comic strip featuring Varag, Griff, graft, and a good game gone gruesomely awry.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hannibal's Revenge
Description:
Hannibal’s Revenge is the second in the Card Conquest game series in which players recreate epic military contests of history in short, comparatively simple, easy-to-learn but hard-to-master games. As with the first game in the series, Hitler's Reich, Hannibal’s Revenge  sets up in minutes and plays to a conclusion in one sitting of two hours (or less). These are not simulations but games, albeit ones packed with enough historical flavor and decision-making to give players the feeling that “you are there” at the highest levels of command.

In Hannibal’s Revenge, the 23 uneasy years of peace between the arch-rival republics of Rome and Carthage come to an end by Hannibal Barca. Son of the Carthaginian hero in their earlier conflict, he vowed since childhood to take revenge for his country's humiliating defeat in that war. Now the time has come to redeem that pledge, and he laid siege to the city of Saguntum in Spain. Rome, incensed over this attack on their ally, mobilizes for war in response.

It is now 219 B.C. (or in the Roman calendar 534 Ab Urbe Condita -that many years since the founding of the city). As the Senate and People of Rome, will you succeed in making Carthage pay for this insult and once again force upon them a humiliating peace? Or as the elders of Carthage, will you restore your city’s rightful place in the Mediterranean world to bring honor and glory to your people through victories gained in Hannibal’s Revenge?

Hannibal’s Revenge mixes deck building mechanisms with area control on a map of the Western Mediterranean. There are several ways players can win: by capturing the enemy capital (without losing their own), reducing your opponent's hand size to zero, or (as Carthage) holding out until the game ends. To accomplish all this, players can capture cities and/or play event cards that help them strengthen their hand—or weaken that of their opponent.

A player’s hand is composed of conflict cards ranging in strength from 1 to 13. Some of these cards have special powers, such as the ability to re-roll one or more dice. In conflict, the strength of these cards is complimented with the roll of the dice (standard 3, but up to 5 with events and leaders). Rome’s deck is divided into two “suits”: one for the Republic of Rome itself (e.g. “The Legions”) and another for its Latin Allies. Cathage’s conflict cards are similarly divided: one suit representing the core Carthaginian army and another for their Gallic, Spanish, and other Allies/Mercenaries.

Conflict cards can also be used to move leaders (e.g. Hannibal or his brother Hasdruble and a pool of Roman leaders of varying quality whom a Senate game mechanism assigns to command Rome’s field armies). These leaders represent their armies which move upon the game map—a map divided into sea and land areas (yes, Hannibal can again perform his legendary march across the Alps!) with some land areas identified as Roman, Carthaginian, or Neutral, some of which contain Fortified Walled Cities. Such Cities may be besieged…a sometime perilous and time-consuming enterprise.

Players may also use one or more Event cards to influence the outcome of the conflict. Conflict arises when a player tries to capture a territory or when he tries to acquire a new Event card from one of three available decks: Roman, Carthaginian, or mixed (available for both parties).

Hannibal's Revenge includes a built-in solitaire bot system to enhance solo play. For those who want to play with more than two, it also includes optional rules for 3-4 players.

Components:

One 17” x 22” Mounted Map
54 Conflict Cards (four suits of 13 cards plus 2 Prodotis - i.e. “Traitor”- cards)
72 Hannibal's Revenge Event Cards
16 Leader Cards
Ten six-sided dice (five white, five black)
140+ Assorted Wooden pieces, Cubes, and Cylinders
2 Player Aid Sheets
1 Solitaire Player Aid Sheet
Rules of Play manual (this booklet) -
Playbook (which includes Rules for Solitaire Play)

TIME SCALE: When both players' Conflict Card decks get shuffled, a sexennium (6 years) is complete. The game can end at any moment, but will last no more than three such sexennia.

MAP SCALE: Land Areas, Major Cities, and Sea Zones (some of which can be hazardous to traverse).

UNIT SCALE: Combat strengths are determined for each combat by card play and dice rolls.

NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 1 – 2 (with optional rules for 3-4)

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Skaven Team Card Pack
Description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Skaven teams.

– 5 Player Reference cards for Skaven Clanrat Linemen, Gutter Runners, Throwers, Blitzers, and Rat Ogres
– 2 Star Player cards for Glart Smashrip and Hakflem Skuttlespike
– 8 Random Event Special Play cards
– 8 Dirty Tricks Special Play cards
– 20 Blank Player cards: 11x Skaven Clanrat Lineman, 4x Gutter Runner, 2x Thrower, 2x Blitzer, and 1x Rat Ogre
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl: the Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Dwarf Team Card Pack
Description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Dwarven teams.

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl: the Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Skrull Halfheight – Star Player
Description:
Every once in a while, a player appears that breaks the mould. Skrull Halfheight was a Dwarf blessed with a prodigious passing ability. Unfortunately for Skrull, his receivers were Dwarfs, and as he waited for one of them to trundle slowly into position, the opposition executed a career-ending tackle on the unfortunate Thrower. This beautiful game wasn't done with Skrull, though, and he was resurrected by none other than famous Necromancer coach, Tomolandry, eager to try out a long game for his own Champions of Death.

A Dwarf Thrower, they ask with eyebrows raised incredulously? Your opponents won't underestimate him more than once... This unconventional Star Player can be Induced by any Sylvanian Spotlight and Worlds Edge Superleague team to add a frankly impressive passing strategy. As befitting a player with no flesh and blood, Skrull is cool under pressure and very survivable (so to speak, anyway) – ideal for mixing it up on the Line of Scrimmage and then sending the ball sailing out to a breakaway catcher on the other side.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 7 pieces, and comes supplied with a 32mm Round Blood Bowl Base. You can find all the rules you need to use Skrull in Blood Bowl – The Official Rules.

-description from the publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules to use this player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Gretchen Wächter – Star Player
Description:
There are some poor souls who find themselves wedded to a Blood Bowl fan of such boundless enthusiasm that it encroaches into every aspect of daily life. Important dates and anniversaries are ignored or forgotten, and family functions are avoided. Before long, the unfortunate lover begins to resent the beautiful game. In time, a strong hatred of Nuffle, and all his wonders, is fostered and domestic bliss becomes a thing of the past! Such was the case with Gretchen Wächter, whose husband was utterly obsessed with Blood Bowl when they were still alive. The Necromancer and aspiring coach Dirk the Abhorrent turned the animosity Gretchen held for the game into a finely-honed weapon and unleashed her scorn against her rival players – the pitch has never been the same since.

The legendary 'Blood Bowl Widow' is a frighteningly solid Star Player, despite being wholly incorporeal. Gretchen's set of skills make it hard for your opponents to get their hands on her, robbing their momentum and frustrating even their Big Guys. She can be Induced to play for any Sylvanian Spotlight team, bolstering their defensive line and skipping right past their biggest players on offence.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 7 pieces, and comes supplied with a 32mm Round Blood Bowl Base. You can find all the rules you need to use her in Blood Bowl – The Official Rules.

-description from publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules for this Star Player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Zolcath The Zoat – Star Player
Description:
Zoats are an exceptionally rare sight, and to find one on the Blood Bowl pitch is all but unheard of. Zolcath seems to play as much for his own amusement as anything else, he will only allow a team to hire him once they find his hidden lair.

Not only is Zolcath a strong player in his own right, with the stats and skills to dominate the gridiron, he’s a Zoat! Your opponents will gaze in awe when you put him on the table, and so will the players lining up against him on the Line of Scrimmage.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 16 pieces, including a 40mm round base. Zolcath the Zoat is available to play for Lustrian Superleague and Elven Kingdoms League teams. You can find all the rules you need to use him in your games of Blood Bowl in the Second Season Official Rules.

description from the publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules for this Star Player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac

Name: Clash of Rage: The Worshippers of Nivi
Description:
Expansion “The Worshipers of Nivi” for the game Clash of Rage. Contains a new clan.
This expansion is not a standalone. You need CLASH OF RAGE to play with it.

The faction comes with:
x8 servants - attack 5, move 3, hearts 1
x6 ascetics - attack 2, move 2, hearts 2
x3 gurus - attack 3, move 2, hearts 3
Bastion tile
Tactics cards x7
Torg miniature and card
Equipment card x8

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine
Description: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine lets you discover or rediscover the Lorraine region, in North-east France with questions in 6 categories.

Name: Pays Graylois: Le jeu
Description:
The game of the Pays Graylois is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the Pays Graylois: Val de Gray, Monts-de-Gy and Quatre Rivières... 
and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities, traditions, heritage....

Name: 1863: London Underground
Description:
A Victorian London setting sees players compete for financial success with numerous historical companies that can be founded, acquired, merged, and folded to represent an alternative history of the London Underground from its audacious beginnings to its eventual semi-nationalisation in 1933 under the umbrella of the London Passenger Transport Board.

1863 London Underground is railroad operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series of games, and based on the rules from the excellent 1817. The small geographic location and the addition of subsidiaries, operating costs, and the looming shadow of the LPTB are some of the main features that set it apart.

Each turn players can open new, or buy/sell shares in existing companies. These companies expand their underground network by laying track and running trains to generate revenue. This can be paid as dividends to share holders or retained to purchase new trains and cover expenses.

The end of the game occurs when either the last train is purchased or only one company remains. At this point the player with the highest personal wealth in cash and assets wins. With no luck involved, success is found through careful planning, shrewd decisions and ruthless actions.

-description from designer

Name: Stick Stack: Cool Black
Description:
You don't want to be stuck with sticks in Stick Stack, so try to place them as carefully as you can on the wobbling tower in the center of the playing area.

Each turn, you either draw a stick from the bag or choose one of the sticks in front of you (in case you had collected any on an earlier turn), then you place that stick onto the tower — but when you place it, the colors on that stack can touch only matching colors on the crow's nest or on other sticks that have already been placed. (If a stick slides onto other colors later as the tower tilts and wobbles, that's okay, but you need to match when placing!)

If any sticks fall off the tower on your turn, collect them and place them in front of you. When all the sticks have been placed onto the tower or when the tower falls over, the game ends immediately. If you caused the tower to fall, you don't collect any of the sticks, but you do score five points (which isn't good). Every player scores one point for each stick in front of them.

If anyone has eleven or more points, the game ends and the player with the lowest score wins.

Stick Stack Cool Black is a new version of the origin Stick Stack game. It provides a cooler color selection and challenge cards element to enhance the game play experience.

Name: It Takes A Thief
Description:
A modular 3D board game where players take on the roles of thieves to steal loot to complete objectives.
The thief with the most prestige point after a set amount of rounds wins.
Difficulty is modified by adding or subtracting "Guard" cards along with longer or shorter games via more or less rounds.
Tiles are placed on each turn, making the dwelling more accessible to the players.
Players have the option to: defeat or evade guards, and disarm or evade traps.
Inventory management by using a player board means that not every piece of loot can be taken.
Items are used to gain bonuses, or complete objectives, the players must choose wisely.

Name: Le Mans et son Pays: Le jeu
Description:
Le Mans et son Pays is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers in the department of Sarthe... and then go travel all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

The winner will have to be the first one to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

Name: Monopoly: Circuit Paul Ricard
Description:
Be the first to buy the headlights stages of Paul Ricard (curves, chicanes, etc.) as soon as you can. Build houses and hotels and collect rents up during the game. Win your opponents at auctions, negotiate with them the properties you wish to acquire.

In a word, take risks, be as smart and gagnez the game! 
And for even faster parts: play dice with the new faster you move on the board, you will become the richest in record time!

The Paul Ricard Circuit is the heart of the "Destination Castelet", a unique site dedicated to recreation and tourism in the south of France, in the heart of Provence, between sea and editing. The infrastructure of the Circuit Paul Ricard, technological innovation, design and architecture today make this place a feeling of space for communication, event operations and leisure around the automobile in general.

Name: The Birth of the Stone Monkey
Description:
This picture book and game tells the story of The Birth of Stone Monkey. In Aolai Country, there is an island called Mountain of Flowers and Fruit which has a magic stone on the top of it. The stone receives the power from nature and bursts open one day to produce a stone monkey. The stone monkey leaps straight to the waterfall to explore and travel across the continents and oceans to worship Patriarch Subhut for learning skills.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: recognize three-dimensional graphics; recognize numbers; understand locations and directions; recognize time, and recognize plane figures and colors. It also includes an observance ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- The Birth of the Stone Monkey: Fill the picture that shows the scene of the Mountain
- Jump into the Cave of Water Curtains: Help the monkey jump into the cave of water curtains
- Monkey King in the Cave of the Water Curtains: Help the monkeys host the feast
- Search for Three-Stared Cave: Find Three-Stared Cave
- Pass Down the Magic in the Middle of the Night: Find out the exact time to meet Master Bodhisattva
- 72 Transfigurations: Help Wukong learn three kinds of transfigurations

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Uproar in Heaven
Description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Uproar in Heaven. Sun Wukong returned after learning and found golden cudgel while he explores the Dragon Palace, signed the book of life and death at King Yama's place, and uproar in the Heaven.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Master arithmetic within 20; Understand Spatial Transformation; Recognize shapes and locations change; Recognize plane figures and understand regularity. It also includes a reaction ability training activity.

To win 6 levels in the game:
- Treasure Hunt in Dragon Palace: Help Wukong escape the Dragon Palace.
- The book of Life and Death: Fold the book of life and death
- Uproar in Heaven: Defeat the rivals
- Casting spells in Peach Garden: Freeze the seven fairies
- Erlang Shen: Get to know the secret of 72 transfigurations
- Escape the Cauldron: Help Wukong get out of the Cauldron

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

Name: The Battle for Hamburger Hill
Description:
This game challenges the players to re-fight the Battle for Hamburger Hill. Can you, as the U.S. player, destroy the NVA, capture the hill and deny the enemy their base area? Or will the NVA player triumph and hold their ground? Get ready to re-live or re-write history in the battle for Hamburger Hill!

The Battle for Hamburger Hill lasts 11 turn-pair game-days (with a night turn each game-day also).  Each turn, players alternate moving and attacking each other’s forces on the game map, which is divided into hexes.  Combat can include small arms firefights between adjacent units or fire missions that target hexes with artillery, airstrikes, helicopter gunships and mortars.

At the end of each combat phase, once all fire combat is complete, adjacent units may conduct close quarters combat (CQC) to decide which force will occupy contested hexes.  Each game-day, after all movement and combat is completed, both sides draw cards to determine special actions for the future day’s turns and may get reinforcements according to card events, history and the roll of the dice.

As the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) player, your goal is to hold hill 937 and hill 916.  If, at the end of the last turn, the U.S. player does not control both of the summit hexes, you have won.

As the Allied player, your goal is to control both summit hexes at the same time.  Whenever the U.S. player has accomplished this at the end of a game-day, the game ends with a U.S. victory.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Tame Four Disciples
Description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Tame Four Disciples. Sun Wukong was sealed under the Five Elements Mountain for five hundred years. Tang Sanzang released Sun and they finally met. After that, Tang tamed the white horse in Eagle's Sorrow Gorge, won over Zhu Bajie in Old Gao Village, and fought with Sha Wujing at the River of Flowing Sands.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Understand graphical decomposition and combination; Recognize numbers within 100; Understand the set of the numbers, and draw route map. It also includes a focus ability training activity and a logical ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- Five Elements Mountain: Help Tang Sanzang climb to the top of the mountain
- Band-tightening spell: Recognizing numbers within 100/dynamic memory
- Tame the Bailong in the Yingchou Mountain Stream: Guess and see who is fastest and most correct
- Zhu Bajie carry his wife: Scratch off the coating and see who Bajie is really carrying
- Tame Zhu Bajie in Yunzhan Cave: Search every corner of the cave
- Tame Sha Monk in Quicksand River: Defeat the rival

After player complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. 
The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Flip & Phrase
Description:
Flip & Phrase is a game that allows children to use Chinese words flexibly, make sentences by association, and makeup stories creatively. In the first half of the game, children do not need to write, so they can focus on their creation. The second half is "writing", using associative memory, writing out keywords, and recreating the scene of the story. In the game, there are 200 frequently used words from the Chinese primary school vocabulary list. The vocabulary list requires children to master the dictation of the words and be proficient in basic Chinese words. Using the form of "oral composition" and "extract keywords", the game lowered the difficulty of the composition and raise the children's learning interest in this subject. The game also makes full use of the means of "listening, speaking, reading, and writing", combined with a real-time feedback mechanism that children can fully use their imagination to break the shackles of thinking and master the skills of composition.

Game setup: Each player takes a player map and its corresponding scoreboard, a pencil, and a sheet of notepaper. Each player draws 5 word cards. Hold them in the hand and don't let other players see them

To start the game: Reverse the hourglass for timekeeping. All players have 30 seconds to prepare an impressive story with the 5 words on the card. After 30 seconds, all players place the cards face down on their map from left to right, starting with the first player and telling each player's story in a clockwise manner. To end the game: When all players have finished telling the story, invert the hourglass and wait 30 seconds, then write down the other players' words in order on a sheet of notepaper. When one player has written all the words can be remembered, place the paper in the center of the table and turn the hourglass around again. The other players have another 30 seconds to continue to recall and record words.

After all players submit their answers, the words will be revealed by the order of storytelling. Players will give their scoring marks to the player who first turned in the notepaper with all words in a correct manner. 1 point for each correct word (correct order and spelling), 2 points for each player who memorizes 5 words from your story, 2 points for each score mark earned from another player, and -2 points for the player's own score mark. The player with the highest total score wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stack Poetry
Description:
An education board game combined with primary school level Chinese classic poetry!

This fun game of reciting ancient Chinese poems has 105 poem title cards, covering 75 ancient Chinese poems that are required to be learned in the Chinese primary schools. The question cards focus on the design of difficulty levels, from a sentence of the poem, transition to a pair of sentences of the poem, and finally the whole poem. In the game, children can gradually get the sense of achievement of reciting Chinese poetry, through the rapid response mechanism, the game fully mobilized the enthusiasm of children. Once you start the game, you just can't stop!

Game setup: Each player takes one set of pagodas, put the bell on the center of the table. Based on the difficulty level, randomly select material cards, shuffle them into a deck. There are 105 material cards in the game, they are sorted into 3 different levels: primary material cards, intermediate material cards, advanced material cards, 4 sets of pagodas (5 pagodas in each set), one bell

To start the game: Flip one material card, according to the poem, setup the pagodas by the order of color of the sentence. The first player who rings the bell wins the card. To end the game: The first player who won 12 cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Poetry Express
Description:
Come to appreciate the classic Chinese poetry!

Poetry Express contains 75 classic poems that are required to be learned in Chinese primary school. Children can read and appreciate these classic works of "painting in poetry, poetry in painting" through the form of games. In the game, children enjoy the learning experience of poetry with their endless imagination by describing the picture expressed by the poem, knowing the poem, expressing the poem, and imagining the artistic conception of the poem.

Game setup: Shuffle the cards into a deck, use the top card of the deck to form a 5*5 square matrix with the cards face up. Shuffle the question stick, put them into the container and set it at a convenient place, put the hourglass aside

To start the game: Shake the question stick container, randomly draw 2 sticks, show the 4 keywords on both sides of the display to all players. After all of the players have confirmed the keywords, the first play reverse the hourglass, all players find and take the poem cards that meet the requirements from the square mix. Players check each other's poem cards after taking the cards that meet the requirements or after the hourglass's time is over. If a player picks up a poem card that doesn't match any keywords, the player should put all the poem cards taken from this round in front of them with the frontside of the cards facing up. If the poetry cards you take meet more than 1 requirement, for each additional keyword meet the requirement, you can take an additional poetry card from the deck (with the backside facing up, without checking the frontside of the card) as a reward, put all the poems cards and reward cards in front of you with the backside of the card facing up

To end the game: The game ends when there is no more question stick to draw or cannot complete the 5*5 square matrix with the poem cards. Each backside-up poem card counts 1 point, and each two frontside-up poem cards counts -1 point. Less than two frontside-up cards will not count the score. The player with the highest total score is the winner.

-description from publisher

Name: Recycle!
Description:
A new day begins, the peaceful town is getting noisy. As life changes with each passing day, the town radiates vitality all the time. However, tons of garbage are ruining the environment. In order to improve the situation of this, an increasing number of waste disposal factories have been erected.

As the engineers of the factory, you are not only responsible for maintaining the daily operation of the factory, but also have to help the factory to become the top one out of all the other factories. Are you ready for the new events and the recycling work you promised?

In the game, you need to earn resources by collecting garbage, and then put the resources in the factory to be converted into Guokr coin. The event cards of each round will affect your work efficiency. Upgrading the factory level allows you to get points faster for the game. At the end of the game, the player who has the highest points will win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Extra Players Upgrade Set
Description:
Ever wanted to go zombie hunting with the largest posse in the west? The Extra Players Upgrade Set allows you to expand your Zombicide games to up to 12 players at once! It contains:

6 Plastic Survivor Dashboards
6 Counter Bases in new colors
48 Plastic Pegs in new colors
6 Starting Equipment cards

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: Sneaker War
Description:
The most desired (limited edition) sneakers are launching soon! Gather your friends to queue up and buy the sneakers! Suit up, warriors. This is War and get as many shoe boxes as possible!

Players are scalpers and play with cards. Players who collect shoeboxes with 20 points will win the game.

There are sneakers cards, queuer cards and action cards. Sneaker card shows the condition to get scores, i.e. the queuer card limit and also the points which can be taken. Queuer cards and action cards are for your hand management.

Random players begin to play clockwise and each player will choose one colour of queuer cards and action cards. They will be divided into 2 card decks. Each player draw 2 queuer cards and 2 action cards.

During your turn, player can play the queuer card concealed and below the sneaker card. If there are already queuer cards present, put below the last queuer card and queue up. Player may also choose to use action cards to fight against others, to increase own queuer numbers or create chaos. Once the queue vacancy of particular sneaker is full, reveal all queuer cards in this row and check the total queuers of each colour. Player can get points in form of shoeboxes and stack them up (There are 72 mini shoeboxes figure). Any player who collects shoeboxes with 20 points will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: SSTR: Tabletop Miniature Skirmish Game
Description:
It's a french skirmish rules system. Players will have limited actions points to activate miniatures. Players will gain points with frags and objectives. 18 heroes who can be combined with 18 powers. 5 vs 5 combats. Fresh and unique system, streamlined rules but deep strategy. You can play with miniatures you want.

Bienvenue dans ESTR, un livre de règles pour figurines afin de revivre les escarmouches qui enchantent le public de cette fin de millénaire. En équipe de cinq contre cinq, les belligérants vont s’affronter dans des arènes de soixante centimètres sur soixante. Créez un décor selon vos envies. Les parties de ESTR peuvent se dérouler tant en décors urbains que naturels, les lieux et les races des guerriers sont aussi variés que les planètes de notre galaxie.Le jeu n’a pas de figurines imposées, jouez avec n’importe quelle marque et de n’importe quel type. Les règles d’ESTR sont originales et astucieuses à plus d’un titre. Les personnages qui meurent reviennent le tour suivant grâce aux avancées scientifiques, le jeu se déroule en activation alternée. Un système original, inédit et juste vous contraindra à un nombre limité d’activations. Usez de vos jetons d’aptitude avec parcimonie, ils sont aussi puissant que précieux. Ce ne sont que quelques exemples de toutes les particularités d’ESTR que vous trouverez dans ce livre. Jamais un jeu n’a été aussi tactique. Les règles sont fluides et claires, elles ont été pensées pour un jeu stimulant et nerveux sans complexité inutile. A vous de jouer.

Name: Manhattan
Description:
Manhattan is a unification game that always ends with one player (the winner) gathering all their pieces in one group.

Rules:
The game is played on a 6x6 square board covered in a checkered pattern of pieces of two colors, except the the 4 central squares are empty. On your turn you have two options: Move or remove. If you cannot do either you automatically pass. (One player will always have a move.)

• Move:
With one of your pieces that is not part of a group, take the first orthogonal step of the shortest possible walk along a clear path that leads to a friendly piece. That is: Of all clear paths to all friendly pieces, you must choose the one that consists of the smallest number of orthogonal steps, and reduce it by 1 orthogonal step.

• Remove:
Remove one of your pieces that belong in a group of same-colored pieces. You may not make a removal that will split the group the removed piece was part of.

Name: Doppelt oder nichts
Description:
In this game, at least four players try to get rid of their hand cards by discarding either the matching color, number or symbol on the discard pile.  But since everyone wants to win, there is of course the possibility of repeatedly putting a spoke in your fellow player's wheel. Action cards can be used to attack them and prevent someone else from playing their last card first.

Up to this point, the principle sounds familiar to many, but in "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS" (German for "DOUBLE OR NOTHING"), some things work a little differently: For example, it is possible to defend yourself by deflecting the attack on a fellow player, who in turn has the same option to defend himself. In this way, it can hit anyone and you can never be sure to reach the goal without being disturbed.

Constant action is therefore the order of the day and does not end with the cards. Those who are willing to take risks can, sometimes under full physical effort, gain an advantage in this card game. Through interactive, cognitive or coordinated tasks it is possible to prevent the drawing of penalty cards. However, one should then think twice, because whoever fails the task receives double the penalty. The deal is: "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS".

Name: Nassau Pioneer
Description:
Nassau Pioneer is a trick-taking game. During the game Player will deal with PirateTeam, collect goods, control the market. The game can be played with only 54 cards.

At the beginning of a new round, Players without any card in their hand, the game will be over. All Players show their IDcards and calculate the score, the player with the most VP will be the winner.

Name: Al Abordaje
Description:
Preparation:
Each player receives a ship and the 15 balls of one color, which he places in the hold of his own ship.

Roll of the dice:
In turn, the players roll the two dice and advance three balls at the same time through the game circuit as many squares as there are points on the dice. If a star comes out on the roll of the dice, the three balls are advanced as many squares as the other dice indicates, and if the two stars come out, the Discomatic mechanism moves in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Game system:
On each game turn, after the dice are rolled, each player must advance three balls consecutively placed on the board: if the ball located in advance is advanced, the two balls immediately behind must also advance; if you want to advance a ball located in between the heading ball and your boat hold, you must advance those located at its same point of advance or immediately behind it; if you want to play a ball that has not yet entered play, you must advance two others that are still in your own boat (in your side of the board).

The balls, which can only circulate in one direction: towards the opposing boat, can go ahead passing one over the other (even if they are from opposing sides).

In each square there can only be one ball, and if it falls on the square occupied by an opposing ball, it is taken prisoner and placed in the hold of the own ship. This rule also applies to orange squares.

Prisoner rescue:
When, with an exact roll of the dice, with no remaining points, a ball manages to reach an orange square on the opposing ship, it frees as many prisoners as there are points indicated by the immediate roll of a die. If a star appears, the roll is repeated. The ball that has reached the opposing boat is removed from play.

End of game:
The first player who manages to get six balls to the opposing boat wins.

Name: Brains!: Promo Pack
Description:
12 Promotional card for Brains (including the cover card)

Released alongside Kickstarter base game but packaged separately from it.

Name: Culture Shock: The Black British History Quiz Game
Description:
Culture Shock is a fun and educational quiz card game that inspires learning about the history of Black people in Britain spanning over a hundred years.

With 52 question cards, players will test their knowledge on key figures in British history, key dates and events. Question topics range from sports to politics, music to activism.

Players can participate in teams or face off individually. Each question card is worth points. The player or team with the most points wins.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Bajsmemo
Description:
Young children love talking about poop. This game is about learning about different animals' poop.

Look at the picture of the poop, connect it with the right animal and then find the matching pictures.

An educational game that's way too much fun!

--description from publisher

Name: Donions and Dragons
Description:
It's a board game inspired by role-playing games.

Players will have to defeat the enemies of an imaginary dungeon using their fighting dice. It combines strategy, chance, social decisions and companionship.  Perfect for an easy to start game with your friends.

Name: Bobo: Hoera ik ben 4
Description: Bobo celebrates his 4th birthday. Now he can go to school. In the box are four games: getallen memory (number memory), Bobo's wijzerspel (Bobo's spin the wheel game), Bobolino and kleuren-dobbelspel (color dice game).

Name: Death Dome 3,000: Battle on the Waspworth Plateau
Description:
Death Dome is an action strategy game where you control a team of four units inside the Death Dome battleground. The objective of each match is to use your team to capture as many control points and gather as many credits as possible. Between matches, you must equip your team with the best equipment that you can afford.

Play a quick match or a whole campaign series. Try different combinations of characters and equipment. Capture control points, collect beetle shells for defeating enemy units, and free your teammates from jail if they are captured.

Players start with 4 units in a base and get to move 2 units each turn. The match lasts for 6 turns. Each unit phase a unit can move and do 1 action, usually either capture a control point or attack an enemy unit. Players get points for each captured control point or defeated enemy at the end of the match. The player with the most points wins. Points turn into credits and can be used to buy new equipment for the next match. Players can compete in a series of matches.

Players draw cards each turn, with bonus cards for each 5 control points they control. Cards can be used to attack or defend or other abilities. Cards are only redrawn at the start of each turn so players must decide how to manage their hand of attacks and save some for defense.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Virtue Signal: Deplorables
Description:
The Deplorables expansion adds over a hundred new cards to the game, and allows you (finally) to grief other players as a disgusting internet troll.

Deplorables is a game within a game.  The deplorable players use a separate deck all their own, with unique cards, game mechanics and objectives.  You thought it was wild before, hoo boy.

Requires Virtue Signal: The Game to play.

âš ACHTUNG!âš  Deplorables is Probably not for kids and definitely not for the thin-skinned.  While it doesn't actually portray anything explicit, it makes reference to things that are absolutely disgusting.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Virtue Signal: Celebrity NPC Pack
Description:
16 additional NPCs that look like people you might recognize.  Or you might not.

Requires Virtue Signal base game to play.

Includes: Goolagle, Commie Barney Sanderson, Jill-ette, the Skeeze, Sonichu Fan, Ayahuasca Joe, The Best Card in the Universe, The Enigmatic Madam Wu, Fashbook, Definitely Not the CIA, Guðbjorg Þunberp, The Hunger that Dooms Worlds, Dropkicker, American Pravda, Sportzball, and Jenk.

Name: Galaxy Hunters: Stretch Goal Box
Description: All stretch goals from Kickstarter (KS exclusives), including 4 news Mechas (Starfire, Maximus, Black Wasp and Lightning Angel), 4 new pilots (Maya G.A., Mina Nodtrian, Kan Utara, Vash Nightow), Corporations systems, along with new Mechas equipment upgrades and creatures to battle.

Name: Galaxy Hunters: New Ways to Hunt
Description:
Expand your arsenal and abilities with the New Ways to Hunt Expansion. Choose from several new mechanics to enhance your experience:

     Push your luck and take on the mightiest of mutants with Combat Dice. Obliterate your target with critical hits, or miss wildly in your vain attempt at glory.
     Hunt with up to five players.
     Outsmart your fellow mercenaries and disperse Ambassadors throughout the system, gaining resources on their move.
     The Iron Smoker mech, and new Pilot Duar Krill Join in the hunt, ready to spread notoriety, throughout the system.


Choose any of these mechanics at the start of each game. Outwit, outmanoeuvre, and annihilate your foes with News Ways to Hunt.

Name: Death Charades
Description:
Death Charades is a party game that pokes fun at life’s inevitable demise. In timed rounds players draw cards and wordlessly act out the multitude of ways one might meet their maker, seeing how many cards their team can guess before time runs out. If you can play charades you can play Death Charades: Make teams, act out the cards in timed rounds, keep score, don’t actually die. Death Charades is the game where death is the life of the party! We're all going to die someday, so why not have fun while we're all still alive?

Players will split into two teams as evenly as possible. In timed rounds, each player takes 45 seconds drawing one card at a time acting out a cause of death, trying to get their team to guess what is written on the card. No words allowed, and teams alternate until each team member has acted one or two rounds. At the end of two rounds whoever has the most cards guessed correctly wins!

Each copy of Death Charades comes with the game box, 205 death cards, 10 gameplay cards and 4 blanks to write your own deaths.

-description from publisher

Name: Cthulhu Storming: La Casa Stregata
Description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

Strange killings are verifying in the city of George Town, a policeman and a nurse go to investigate in a strange house that seems to be linked with the apparitions of beast-men.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

     explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
     attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
     use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the house and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues, runes and keys that open the way to the final boss (Abor-Kandra), and succeeds in defeating him.

Name: Cthulhu Storming: Orrore a Innsmouth
Description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

The citizen of Newburyport are missing from their houses, therefore an archaeologist and a psychoanalyst go to investigate in the near village of Innsmouth, finding it inhabited by fish-man hybrids.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

     explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
     attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
     use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the map and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues and keys that open the way to the final boss (Dagon), and succeeds in defeating him.

Name: Mosquito Family
Description:
Mosquito Family is about assaulting unsuspecting people and pets with your mosquitoes to collect blood and increase popularity among mosquitoes.
But be careful, otherwise your mosquitoes will have to escape!

Object of the game:
Have the most blood at the end of the game.

Player Turn:
At each turn these steps must be performed:
1. Day or night
If you are the first to take a turn, in this round,  turn the Day/Night card over.
2. Assault a target
Choose an available Target card that has the  Blood face visible and draw Blood cards to assault a target. In case you draw a Look card, or you exceed tolerance limit of the target (based on the visible face of Day/Night card), stop immediately and the Angry face step begins. In the Angry face step, flip Event cards and try to run away!
3. Coming home
Place live Mosquito Tokens that have assaulted a target on the Player Card Blood Track, at the value equal to the amount of blood collected. You can place Mosquito Tokens over the others. Those Mosquito Tokens remain on the blood track until the final scoring.
4. Targets have recovered
If all the Targets Cards have the Angry face visible: turn them so that the Blood face is visible, keep the last 4 event cards and shuffle all the others face-down to form a new deck. In any case turn all Event Cards on the table face-down.

End of the game:
The game ends when all players have no Mosquito tokens to play.
The player with the largest amount of blood is the winner.

Single Player Mode and Cooperative Mode available.

—description from the designer

Name: San-Antonio: Le jeu
Description:
San-Antonio Le jeu the game about San Antonio

Detective Superintendent Antoine San-Antonio is a kind of French James Bond with a "personal" slang rather than gadgets.

Progress along the board answering language questions.

Name: ASL Comp: Invasion Palestine! Sinai-Negev-Galilee
Description:
This is the Invasion Palestine! expansion for owners of GENESIS 3 and MAGACH 73. 
Also needed are ASL RB, and Nationalities, including Russians.

Scenarios:

     Sons of Galilee – Deganiaa, Israel, May 20th 1948
     Etziongrad – Kfar Etzion, Palestine Mandate, May 13th 1948
     Fatih-Allah – Mishmar Hayarden, June 10th 1948
     I Dream of Jenin – Jenin, June 3rd 1948
     The Whiskey Wager – Haifa, April 21st 1948
     Death to the Invaders – Near Hill 113 and Kawkba, The Negev, July 18th 1948
     Molotov Inferno – Semach, Syria, May 20th 1948
     Level the Villages – Kibbutz Mishmar Haemek, Palestine Mandate, April 9th 1948

Name: City of Winter
Description:
City of Winter gives us elegant rules, evocative prompts, and inspiring images to help us create a story as we play to explore characters in a world of our shared imagination. It is infinitely repayable and no two games will ever be the same. Like many Story Games, City of Winter does not need a game master or require any other materials or special preparation to play. Everything you need is in the box!

In City of Winter we tell a story that spans generations where the decisions we make as players define how our family changes over time. Over sessions of play our characters will grow old and pass into memory as new generations are born.

Play centers around the exploration of tradition. As we journey through the world of City of Winter, we will encounter varied traditions of the City represented by decks of Tradition Cards. As our characters change and grow the traditions they hold as a family change as well.

City of Winter takes place in a world of fantasy where things are possible that are not possible in our day to day lives. Use this space to imagine and discover without the restrictions we find in our day to day lives.

—description from the publisher
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: 라온 주사위 (Raon Dice)
Description:
ë¼ì˜¨ ì£¼ì‚¬ìœ„ (Raon Dice) is a game of rolling dice and making words by using vowels and consonants from the dice roll. In the process of combining the vowels and comparing the results, you can easily become familiar with Hangul (í•œê¸€) while having fun.

ë¼ì˜¨ ì£¼ì‚¬ìœ„ comes with four different ways to play using the components in the box.

Name: Monopoly: New York Yankees Collectors Edition
Description:
Mr. Monopoly hits one out of the ballpark in the Yankees Collector's edition of the Monopoly Game. With 39 American League Pennants and 26 World Series Trophies under their belt, a record in both cases, the Yankees set the bar for every other ball club in Major League Baseball.

In this completely customized MONOPOLY game, fans of the Bronx Bombers can buy, sell and trade all-star Yankees players like Derek Jeter, Mariano Rivera and Alex Rodriguez - as well as some of the newer Yankees players like Robinson Cano and clean cut Johnny Damon. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: Yankees cap, batter, pitcher, ball in glove, World Series trophy and catcher’s mask.

Name: 라온 더하기 (Raon Plus)
Description:
ë¼ì˜¨ ë”í•˜ê¸° (Raon Plus) is a game of making the best use out of transparent cards with Hangul (í•œê¸€) alphabet or special characters to make words. Combine the alphabets in various ways and freely express your imagination.

ë¼ì˜¨ ë”í•˜ê¸° comes with three different ways to play with the components in the box.

Name: Dino Diner
Description:
It’s survival of the fattest in a pre-historic race to invent the restaurant!  But this quest for fryers is fraught with danger!  The more you cook for hungry customers, the more attention you draw from ravenous dinosaurs whose monstrous appetites can only be sated by one of three things – your dwindling food supplies, your customers, or you!

Primarily a set collection game with push-your-luck elements and heaping portion of player interaction, Dino Diner combines strategy and angst into a light meal of a game.

—description from the designer

Name: Family Feud Blockbuster Movie Edition
Description:
FAST-PACED FUN: Family Feud Blockbuster Game is an exciting, fast-paced game for everyone 12+. Teams take turns trying to guess the most popular answers to 200 survey questions about film!
MOVIES, MOVIES AND MORE MOVIES: Can you name a former TV star who became an A-lister? How about naming a movie with a made-up language? Brush up on your movie smarts because there are hundreds of survey questions waiting for your answers.
PLAY FACE OFF AND FAST MONEY ROUNDS: Just like on the show, you’ll compete in two categories. Play three Face Off rounds before you try the Fast Money round where everything can change with a simple answer!
QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Just take the game out of the box, set up the components, choose your teams and get ready to play! For 3 or more players, ages 12 and up.
Includes: 150 Face Off Cards, 50 Fast Money Cards, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, Instructions

Name: Flip'M
Description:
The game comes in a cup. The object to be flipped is M-shaped when stood upright. Players press on the 'valley' of the M using the tip of the finger and the piece will shoot upwards.

The objective of the game is to score the highest number of points in seven shots. Two points for flipping the piece into the cup and one point for hooking it on the edge.

—user summary

Name: Monopoly: New York City Edition
Description: Interested in beating Donald Trump at his own game? With this New York City version of classic Monopoly, the most prized real estate in the Big Apple is available, and at bargain rates. The Brooklyn Bridge has never been so cheap--$100 for the whole thing--and for only $60, take Staten Island as well. Comes with eight unique pewter tokens, including a top hat and a racing car, as well as the usual stacks of money, dice, and Chance cards. Take a whirl around the board, land on Times Square or Broadway, then see if you can pick up a penthouse on Central Park East for a song.

Name: Monopoly: Disney Villains Collectors Edition
Description:
Monopoly; Disney Villains Edition Game lets you relive the excitement of all your favorite Disney villains -- from Chernabos to Ursula -- with this very special edition of the classic Monopoly; board game. Magic Mirror and Cauldron cards might make your dreams come true or they might bring an unexpected trip to jail. Use your Wishes wisely to collect the deeds to Disney Villains belongings; increase their value on your way to victory!

The game board is different from Monopoly: My Disney Villains.

Name: Monopoly: Orlando Edition
Description: Monopoly with a Orlando, Florida theme.

Name: Monopoly: Care Bears
Description: Have a rainbow day! Catch some fun as you buy, sell, and trade the Care Bears and their Cousins in MONOPOLY®: Care Bears edition. With each roll of the dice, pick up a beloved friend like Wish Bear, Funshine Bear, or Grumpy Bear, then use Star Buddies to add Hearts and Cloud Castles to your properties. Choose your favorite token like the Hot Air Balloon, Cloud Car or the Rainbow Roller as you travel through Care-a-lot picking up friends. Every day is special when you let the fun shine in.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Fields of Fire: The Bulge Campaign
Description:
The 9th Infantry Regiment “Manchus,” 2nd Infantry Division faced three weeks of intense combat from December 13th, 1944 to January 8th, 1945 as part of the Battle of the Bulge. This campaign covers those critical days. The Campaign consists of seven new missions featuring a new Terrain Deck for the forests, fields, and villages of the Ardennes. The counter sheet includes a U.S. heavy machine gun platoon, Bangalore torpedoes, anti-tank mines, wire entanglements, German tanks, assault guns, Panzergrenadiers, and Volksgrenadiers.

We left the “Manchus” of World War Two in Fields of Fire: Volume I at the close of the Normandy Campaign. The 2nd Infantry Division was rapidly moved to join the assault on the port city of Brest, in Brittany. The city was captured after heavy fighting from August 21st to September 18th. By that time, the German resistance elsewhere in France had collapsed, and the 2nd Infantry Division raced to Paris, arriving on September 29th. The rapid advance ended on October 4th when the Division entered the region just east of St. Vith, Belgium called the Schnee Eifel on the highly symbolic German border. The 2nd Infantry Division relieved the 4th and 28th Infantry Divisions, completing the relief on October 5th. Ahead lay the German border, defended by the Siegfried Line cutting across difficult terrain.

The “Manchus” were able to incorporate replacements and prepare for whatever would come next throughout October and November. This period saw frequent patrol activity but no major combat actions. On December 10th, the 2nd Infantry Division began a relief in place by the 106th Infantry Division. By the 11th, the relief was complete, and the Division gathered at Camp Elsenborn to prepare for the renewed offensive. The attack north through the Siegfried line would commence on December 13th.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Monopoly: Venetian Palazzo Las Vegas
Description:
One of the largest casino complexes in the world has teamed up with the world's most famous board game to bring you MONOPOLY's The Venetian Palazzo Edition.

Buy Sell and Trade the most popular locations in the complex in an effort to own it all: Wheel and deal VIP lounge, High Limit Slot Salon, and St. Marks Square are just some of the locales you can own in this version.

Includes:
60 minute speed play rules
32 houses renamed suites
6 collectible tokens

Name: Twin Play Classics: Clue and Sorry
Description:
Two of the world's favorite family games, Clue and Sorry, in an beautiful boxed set.

These board games were a combination of two popular classic games contained in a premium wooden box, with the idea that they would grace a coffee table. The boards of each paired game were on each other's flip side. The case came with a brass plate and was sometimes called The Collector's Edition. It was marketed as a game that would "a great gift" or "part of your family's collection".
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Garbage Gatherers
Description:
The amount of space garbage is growing and the Earth Government has decided that this is the moment to do something. And your mech company has been selected to do the job! Take your flies and your hulk mechs to gather the garbage, extract the valuable resources and mine more bytecoins than your opponents!

On you turn, you will select one of your mech to move. If you select a Fly mech, you can go around the factories to gather some garbage or you can cross over the factories to drop the garbage previously gathered.

If there is enough garbage on a factory, it will be automatically transformed into bytecoins. Don't miss the chance to move the Spider mech to try to gather those valuable bytecoins!

The other option on your turn is to move a Hulk mech. These mech also gather those valuable bytecoins from the factories, but even more important, they won't let other Fry mech pass!

The first player who get the target amount of bytecoins will be the best Garbage Gatherer, and thus, will win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Kanalratten
Description: In the underground of Korrupttown - also known as Fastfoodcity, rat gangs fight for supremacy and divide the city amongst themselves.  The rats are divided into four gangs by the color of their tails: blue, green, yellow, and red. Whoever controls the most feeding places have the most followers and power. The player who controls half of all the feeding places wins the game.

Name: DiceWar: Knights of Steel
Description:
Expansion Nr. 4 for DiceWars. This new expansion introduce new movement and battle formation abilities. The new faction, "Knights of Steel", has a special dangerous defense.

—description from the publisher

Name: Live On
Description:
In Live On you take on the role of a survivor and try to escape the onslaught of zombies. Find weapons, use your skills, try to survive alone or in a team.

In 4 different types of missions, each with 3 different map sizes, you have to try to meet the mission requirements and escape alive.
You also have the opportunity to design your own map and create your own missions.

How many zombies you have to fight against is decided by your luck when you roll the dice. Is it 2 or is it 10?
But not only the zombies are your opponents, you can also decide to play against each other.

—description from the publisher

Name: Colorbot
Description:
The life is sad in Robotcity. Hopefully you will be able to change that. On kid advice, the robots decide replace their dark fuel by color paint.

Colorbot is a print and play where player will color the bot they have in their laboratory (sheet).
Each turn will will pick two markers, then use the first one and the second one. Having fuel block filled :

     of only one color will bring you 3 points and the robot will gain an eye (draw it)
     of three different colors 2 points and an antenna


(If you have only two colors...0 points).
When two of your 3 robots are power-on, the game ends.

An other laboratory (sheet) is provided with advanced rules (more ways to score).

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Railroad Empires: Red Company
Description:
Expansion for Small Railroad Empires featuring 5th player pieces, and extra components such as: new achievement card, and 4x new train (wild) cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Railroad Empires: Scenario Pack 1
Description:
Expansion for Small Railroad Empires featuring Scenario Maps of: United States, Europe, Germany and the United Kingdom.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Railroad Empires: Scenario Pack 2
Description:
Expansion for Small Railroad Empires featuring Scenario Maps of: Australia, Canada, France and Italy.

—description from the publisher

Name: ASL Comp: Magach 73 – The Yom Kippur War of 1973
Description:
Magach 73 is an expansion for Genesis.

One of the Genesis games is needed to play this, preferably Genesis II or III. 
Plus the standard ALSer Modules with British, Russians, and the ASLRB.

-description from the publisher

Name: Schuß ... Tor!
Description:
Each player gets 11 pawns he puts on the marked starting positions (white numbered spaces). The first player to get all of his 11 pawns into the opponents goal wins the game (I didn't know soccer is played this way and shouldn't there be a ball?).

Movement is determined by a die. Friendly meeples may never be jumped over, opponent meeples only if a 6 is rolled. If a meeple is on the opposite side of the playing field, the player has to mind the rules regarding the colored squares.

—user summary

Name: SwiftWave: the turn-cutting action card game
Description: A turn-cutting action card game for 3-8 players where the fastest to discard all their cards wins. There are only two actions in the game: wait for your turn to play, or wave cut to steal another player’s turn. Swiftness is key; your turn and the opportunity to win may just pass you by.

Name: Azul: Summer Pavilion – Glazed Pavilion
Description:
A brand new floor!

Azul: Glazed Pavilion offers players 2 newly designed player boards and matching scoring boards to compete over and a set of 4 overlays to keep Azul Glazed Pavilion tiles neatly organized. Offering the best of both worlds — beauty and new game elements — Glazed Pavilion is a must-have expansion for Azul fans!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Paradox Initiative
Description:
"Our newest discovery changes everything! Our paradox engine lets us manipulate paradox particles, the fundamental building blocks of reality. Past, present, and future—none are beyond our grasp, and nobody can stand in our way! Except, that is, maybe the frauds at that rival paradox lab down the street. Quickly, to the control room. Switch off the safeties, there’s renown to be won!”

In The Paradox Initiative, players are mad scientists competing to claim strands of spacetime from worlds all across the multiverse. Who can most efficiently operate their particle-matching "Paradox Engine" to collect data from the different worlds? Be careful! Your collecting sends ripples throughout existence, collapsing the connections that future generations will need to reap the benefits of your reckless experiments.
